# Getting Your N2YO API Key
Follow these steps to obtain a free API key from N2YO for satellite tracking.
## Step-by-Step Guide
### 1. Visit the N2YO API Page Go to: **https://www.n2yo.com/api/**
### 2. Create an Account - Click on **"Sign up"** or **"Register"** (usually in the top right corner) - Fill in the registration form: - **Email**: Your valid email address - **Username**: Choose a username - **Password**: Create a secure password - **Confirm Password**: Re-enter your password - Click **"Register"** or **"Sign Up"**
### 3. Verify Your Email - Check your email inbox for a verification email from N2YO - Click the verification link in the email - This will activate your account
### 4. Log In to Your Account - Go back to https://www.n2yo.com/ - Click **"Login"** - Enter your username/email and password - Click **"Sign In"**
### 5. Navigate to API Section - Once logged in, go to **"My Account"** or **"API"** section - Look for **"API Key"** or **"Manage API Keys"** - Your API key should be displayed on this page
### 6. Copy Your API Key Your API key will look something like this: ``` ABC123-DEF456-GHI789-JKL012 ```
**Important**: Keep this key private and don't share it publicly!
### 7. Add the API Key to the App
**Open this file:** ``` app/src/main/java/com/example/sat_trak/data/repository/SatelliteRepository.kt ```
**Find this line (around line 17):** ```kotlin private val apiKey = "YOUR_API_KEY_HERE" ```
**Replace it with your actual API key:** ```kotlin private val apiKey = "ABC123-DEF456-GHI789-JKL012" // Your actual key ```
**Save the file** and rebuild the app.
## API Key Limits (Free Tier)
The free N2YO API tier typically includes: - ✅ **1,000 requests per hour** - ✅ **All satellite tracking endpoints** - ✅ No credit card required
Since the app updates every 10 seconds and tracks 3 satellites, it makes: - **3 API calls every 10 seconds** = 18 calls/minute = 1,080 calls/hour
**Note**: This is slightly over the free limit. Consider increasing the update interval to 12-15 seconds if needed.
### To Change Update Interval:
Open `SatelliteViewModel.kt` and modify: ```kotlin delay(10000) // Update every 10 seconds ```
Change to: ```kotlin delay(15000) // Update every 15 seconds (720 calls/hour) ```
## Troubleshooting
### Problem: Can't find API key on N2YO website **Solution**: - Make sure you're logged in - Check the "My Account" or "API" section in the navigation menu - Contact N2YO support if you still can't find it
### Problem: API returns "unauthorized" error **Solution**: - Verify the API key is copied correctly (no extra spaces) - Make sure you've verified your email address - Check if your API key is activated
### Problem: API returns "rate limit exceeded" **Solution**: - You've exceeded 1,000 requests/hour - Increase the update interval in `SatelliteViewModel.kt` - Wait until the next hour for the limit to reset
### Problem: API returns no data **Solution**: - Check your internet connection - Verify the satellite NORAD IDs are correct (25544, 33591, 36585) - Check the N2YO service status at their website
## Alternative: Use a Different API Key Storage Method
For better security, consider storing the API key in `local.properties`:
1. **Open** `local.properties` (or create it in the project root) 2. **Add**: `n2yo_api_key=YOUR_ACTUAL_KEY_HERE` 3. **Update** `build.gradle.kts` to read from this file 4. **Add** `local.properties` to `.gitignore` (already done)
This prevents accidentally committing your API key to version control.
## Support
If you have issues: - **N2YO Support**: https://www.n2yo.com/contact/ - **N2YO Documentation**: https://www.n2yo.com/api/
---
**Happy Satellite Tracking! ️**
